database_info.name: Global Media Database
database_info.purpose: Comprehensive global news sources for Claude Skill - balanced news intelligence
database_info.creator: Sarah Poer / Mother Of Chaos

credibility_ratings.high: Rigorous fact-checking, transparent corrections, strong editorial standards
credibility_ratings.medium: Generally reliable but occasional lapses, less rigorous fact-checking
credibility_ratings.mixed: Quality varies significantly by section or journalist

legitimacy_criteria.tier_1: Automatic inclusion - Established outlets (50+ years), major awards (Pulitzer, etc.), recognized as paper of record, IFCN fact-checker certification
legitimacy_criteria.tier_2: Credentialed individuals - Professional journalism background, verified credentials (PhD, major outlet experience), consistent quality track record
legitimacy_criteria.tier_3: Emerging quality - Transparent practices, documented fact-checking, independent verification possible, growing reputation

usage_notes.for_claude_skill: Cross-reference articles from different political leans and geographic regions. Compare coverage of same event across Center, Left-leaning, and Right-leaning sources. Prioritize 'high' credibility sources. Flag 'propaganda' sources as single-perspective only. Use geographic diversity to avoid Western-centric bias.
usage_notes.fact_checking_method: 1) Identify key claims in article. 2) Search for same claims in sources with different political leans. 3) Check if facts are reported consistently. 4) Flag opinion vs fact. 5) Note when sources disagree on facts (rare for legitimate news). 6) Provide user with factual core + range of perspectives.
usage_notes.bias_handling: Political lean ≠ unreliable. High credibility sources with clear lean are valuable for understanding different perspectives. The goal is presenting facts + noting where interpretation differs.

global_news_agencies.name: Associated Press (AP)
global_news_agencies.political_lean_notes: Moved from Lean Left to Left (Nov 2024) per AllSides review. Some conservative critics note progressive social issue framing.
global_news_agencies.specialty: Breaking news, wire service, global coverage
global_news_agencies.notes: Oldest news agency in USA. Cooperative owned by member newspapers. Pulitzer Prize winner. IFCN certified fact-checker. Updates bias rating based on blind surveys.

global_news_agencies.name: Reuters
global_news_agencies.political_lean_notes: Center rating with high confidence. Recognized as least biased of major agencies.
global_news_agencies.specialty: Financial news, international breaking news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: One of 'Big Three' global agencies. Owned by Thomson Reuters. Multiple Pulitzer Prizes. Reuters Fact Check certified by IFCN. Trust Principles guarantee editorial independence.

global_news_agencies.name: Agence France-Presse (AFP)
global_news_agencies.political_lean_notes: Center. Some right-leaning critics note occasional progressive framing on social issues.
global_news_agencies.specialty: International news, wire service, global coverage
global_news_agencies.notes: One of 'Big Three' global agencies. Public establishment with autonomous status. 2,400 journalists in 260 bureaus across 151 countries. AFP Fact Check certified by IFCN.

global_news_agencies.name: ANSA (Agenzia Nazionale Stampa Associata)
global_news_agencies.ownership: Non-profit cooperative - 36 member newspapers are shareholders
global_news_agencies.specialty: National and international news agency - Italy's leading
global_news_agencies.notes: Founded January 15, 1945 post-WWII by Italian Resistance representatives. Explicitly NOT government-controlled, created as cooperative to avoid government/private control. 22 offices in Italy, 81 offices in 78 countries. Distributes 3,500+ news items, 1,500+ photos daily. IFCN-certified fact-checker. 'Most legitimate source of Italian news internationally.'

global_news_agencies.name: Deutsche Presse-Agentur (DPA)
global_news_agencies.specialty: German and European news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: Germany's largest news agency. Cooperative owned by German media companies. IFCN fact-checker. About 1,000 journalists worldwide.

global_news_agencies.name: EFE
global_news_agencies.specialty: Spanish and Latin American news, wire service
global_news_agencies.notes: Spain's international news agency. Fourth largest wire service globally. Public company but editorially independent. EFE Verifica fact-checking service.

global_news_agencies.name: Xinhua News Agency
global_news_agencies.notes: Official state press agency of China. Directly controlled by Communist Party. Largest in Asia. Useful for understanding Chinese government perspective but NOT independent journalism.

global_news_agencies.name: TASS (Russian News Agency)
global_news_agencies.notes: State-owned news agency. Official government mouthpiece. Useful for understanding Russian government perspective but NOT independent journalism.

global_news_agencies.name: Press Trust of India (PTI)
global_news_agencies.notes: India's largest news agency. Non-profit cooperative. 500+ journalists across India. Provides news to most Indian publications.

global_news_agencies.name: Kyodo News
global_news_agencies.notes: Japan's leading news agency. Nonprofit cooperative owned by member newspapers and broadcasters. About 50 bureaus worldwide.

italy.name: Corriere della Sera
italy.political_lean_notes: Centre/centre-right. Least biased - balanced story selection with both left and right-wing writers.
italy.specialty: General news, Italy's national newspaper of record
italy.notes: Italy's most-read and oldest newspaper. Founded 1876. Represents moderate bourgeoisie. Balanced/impartial reporting. 9M+ monthly website visitors. Over 500K digital subscribers. Cultural supplement La Lettura. 600 correspondents throughout Italy, bureaus in 20 foreign cities. Media Bias Fact Check: Least Biased, High factual reporting.

italy.name: La Repubblica
italy.political_lean_notes: Left-center/centre-left. Founded as radical left, moderated to milder centre-left stance.
italy.ownership: GEDI Gruppo Editoriale (majority owned by Exor/Agnelli family since 2020)
italy.notes: Founded by Eugenio Scalfari & Carlo Caracciolo 1976. Second most-circulated Italian newspaper. 10 local editions. Known for culture, intellect, fact-checking. Ownership: Agnelli family (Fiat, Economist Group). Media Bias Fact Check: Left-Center bias, High factual reporting. Progressive outlet despite corporate ownership.

italy.name: Internazionale
italy.ownership: Independent (founded by Giovanni De Mauro + 3 co-founders, still run by founders)
italy.specialty: Translated international press, long-form journalism, international affairs
italy.notes: Selects and translates best articles from international press into Italian. Weekly magazine. Features work from Noam Chomsky, Christopher Hitchens, Nick Hornby, Joe Sacco, Marjane Satrapi. Organizes annual 'Internazionale a Ferrara' journalism festival (76,000 attendees). Progressive International member. Crucially independent in Italy's media-concentrated landscape. One of Italy's most popular current-affairs weeklies.

italy.name: il Fatto Quotidiano
italy.political_lean_notes: Left-wing populist, anti-establishment. Pro-Five Star Movement.
italy.funding_model: Sales + subscriptions + advertising, NO state subsidies
italy.notes: Third most-visited news site in Italy. Rated most independent and trustworthy online Italian news. Refuses government subsidies unlike rivals. Media Bias Fact Check: Left-Center bias, High factual reporting.

spain.name: El País
spain.notes: Spain's highest-circulation daily. Center-left editorial line. Owned by PRISA. Strong international coverage. English edition available.

spain.name: El Mundo
spain.notes: Spain's second-largest newspaper. Center-right lean. Known for investigative reporting. Owned by Unidad Editorial.

spain.name: elDiario.es
spain.notes: Financially successful independent model. Revenue €2.6M (2015), profitable. Defended source protection in court (CPJ commendation). Third most-visited news site in Spain by traffic.

spain.name: CTXT (Revista Contexto)
spain.specialty: Long-form analysis, political & economic context, culture
spain.notes: Focus on in-depth journalism, not breaking news. Founded by journalists from El País, El Mundo, La Repubblica. Director Miguel Mora was Paris/Rome correspondent for El País for 22 years. Progressive International member.

france.name: Le Monde
france.notes: France's newspaper of record. Center-left editorial line. Employee-owned. Strong international reporting. Les Décodeurs fact-checking team.

france.name: Le Figaro
france.notes: France's oldest national newspaper. Center-right editorial line. High circulation. Owned by Dassault Group.

france.name: Mediapart
france.funding_model: Digital subscriptions only, NO advertising, NO subsidies
france.specialty: Investigative journalism, political corruption, financial fraud
france.notes: Converted to nonprofit 2019 (Fonds pour une Presse Libre). Broken major scandals: Bettencourt affair, Sarkozy-Gaddafi case, Cahuzac affair, Benalla affair. NYT calls it 'France's leading investigative news site'. Sued 200+ times. 6.5M monthly visitors.

germany.name: Der Spiegel
germany.notes: Germany's leading news magazine. Center-left. Known for investigative reporting. English edition Spiegel International.

germany.name: Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (FAZ)
germany.notes: Germany's newspaper of record. Center-right. High-quality journalism. Strong business coverage.

germany.name: CORRECTIV
germany.notes: Germany's first nonprofit investigative newsroom. Staff of 70+. Broken major stories including far-right deportation plan (2024) that sparked massive protests. Runs CORRECTIV.Faktencheck, CORRECTIV.Lokal (1,700+ local journalists network). GIJN member. Multiple journalism awards.

uk.name: BBC News
uk.notes: UK public broadcaster. Funded by TV license fee. Editorial independence. BBC Reality Check fact-checking. Available in 40+ languages.

uk.name: The Guardian
uk.notes: UK left-leaning quality newspaper. Owned by Scott Trust. Reader-funded model. Strong environmental coverage. Multiple Pulitzers.

uk.name: The Telegraph
uk.notes: UK conservative quality newspaper. Owned by Barclay family. Strong political coverage.

uk.name: Financial Times
uk.notes: Leading global business newspaper. Center editorial line. Owned by Nikkei. High-quality analysis.

usa.name: The New York Times
usa.notes: US newspaper of record. Left-center editorial line. 130+ Pulitzer Prizes. Strong international bureau. Paywall model successful.

usa.name: The Washington Post
usa.notes: Major US newspaper. Center-left. Owned by Jeff Bezos. 69 Pulitzer Prizes. Strong political coverage. Fact Checker column.

usa.name: The Wall Street Journal
usa.notes: Leading US business newspaper. News section center, opinion section right. Owned by News Corp. 37 Pulitzer Prizes.

usa.name: NPR (National Public Radio)
usa.notes: US public radio. Membership-funded. Left-center lean. High-quality journalism. 1,000+ member stations.

global_international.name: Al Jazeera
global_international.political_lean_notes: Lean Left / Left-Center. State-funded by Qatar. Straight news minimally biased, opinion pages exhibit significant bias.
global_international.credibility_notes: Straight news: high. Opinion content: lower due to bias. State influence: concern.
global_international.ownership: Qatar Media Corporation / Al Jazeera Media Network (Qatar state-funded)
global_international.specialty: International news, Middle East focus, underrepresented global regions
global_international.notes: First independent news channel in Middle East. 80+ bureaus, 270M households in 140+ countries. STRENGTHS: Covers underrepresented regions, valuable Palestinian perspective. CONTROVERSIES: Not critical of Qatar, opinion pages significant anti-Israel bias, different editorial tones Arabic vs English services. After 10/7/2023, valuable voice for Palestinians. Media Bias Fact Check: Left-Center bias, Mixed factual.

global_international.name: The Economist
global_international.notes: Global news magazine. Center editorial line. Anonymous journalism. Strong analysis. Owned by Economist Group (Agnelli family).

latin_america.name: El Faro
latin_america.notes: Latin America's first online-only publication. ALiados network member. Operates under repressive government (Nicaragua). Multiple journalism awards. Co-founder Carlos Dada in Americas Quarterly Top 5 Journalists.

latin_america.name: Agência Pública
latin_america.notes: Brazil's first nonprofit investigative journalism agency. ALiados network member. Co-founder Natália Viana won Cabot Prize 2024. Major investigations on corruption, environment, human rights.

latin_america.name: Animal Político
latin_america.notes: Major Mexican digital outlet. ALiados network member. El Sabueso fact-checking project. Operates in world's deadliest country for journalists.

latin_america.name: CIPER Chile
latin_america.notes: Center for Investigative Journalism. ALiados network member. Based at Universidad Diego Portales. Major corruption investigations.

latin_america.name: Plaza Pública
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Operates under challenging press freedom conditions.

latin_america.name: IDL-Reporteros
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Strong investigative team.

latin_america.name: Armando.info
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Focus on Venezuelan corruption. Operates in exile.

latin_america.name: Runrun.es
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Major Venezuelan digital outlet despite government pressure.

latin_america.name: Confidencial
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Operating in exile since 2021. Nicaragua has worst press freedom in LatAm (172nd globally).

latin_america.name: El Surtidor
latin_america.notes: ALiados network member. Young but credible Paraguayan outlet.

latin_america.name: Chequeado
latin_america.notes: IFCN-certified fact-checker. Pioneer in Latin American fact-checking.

latin_america.name: El Sabueso
latin_america.notes: Mexican fact-checking project by Animal Político. IFCN-certified.

latin_america.name: Efecto Cocuyo
latin_america.notes: Main independent digital news site in Venezuela. Operating despite fear and repression. Americas Quarterly Top 5 Journalists (Luz Mely Reyes).

canada.name: CBC News
canada.notes: Canada's public broadcaster. Left-center lean. Funded by government but editorially independent.

canada.name: The Globe and Mail
canada.notes: Canada's newspaper of record. Center editorial line. High-quality journalism.

australia.name: ABC News (Australia)
australia.notes: Australia's public broadcaster. Center editorial line. Editorially independent.

australia.name: The Sydney Morning Herald
australia.notes: Major Australian newspaper. Center-left. Owned by Nine Entertainment.

japan.name: The Japan Times
japan.notes: Japan's oldest English-language newspaper. Independent voice in Japanese media landscape.

japan.name: NHK World
japan.notes: Japan's public broadcaster. Center editorial line. International service.

india.name: The Hindu
india.notes: Major Indian newspaper. Center-left. High editorial standards. Family-owned.

india.name: The Times of India
india.notes: India's largest English newspaper. Center. Owned by Bennett Coleman. Mass market focus.

brazil.name: Folha de S.Paulo
brazil.notes: Brazil's most influential newspaper. Center-left. Family-owned. Strong investigative team.

brazil.name: O Globo
brazil.notes: Major Brazilian newspaper. Center. Part of Grupo Globo media conglomerate.

middle_east.name: Haaretz
middle_east.notes: Israel's oldest daily newspaper. Left-leaning, critical of Israeli government. High editorial standards. English edition available.

middle_east.name: The Times of Israel
middle_east.notes: Independent online newspaper. Center editorial line. English-language focus.

science_health.name: Nature
science_health.notes: Leading multidisciplinary science journal. Rigorous peer review. High impact factor.

science_health.name: Science
science_health.notes: Published by AAAS. Rigorous peer review. Covers all scientific disciplines.

science_health.name: The Lancet
science_health.notes: Leading medical journal. Rigorous peer review. Global health focus.

science_health.name: NEJM (New England Journal of Medicine)
science_health.notes: Most prestigious medical journal. Highest impact factor in medicine. Rigorous standards.

science_health.name: Scientific American
science_health.notes: Oldest continuously published magazine in US. Science for general audience. Evidence-based.

technology.name: Ars Technica
technology.notes: In-depth technology journalism. Technical accuracy. Owned by Condé Nast.

technology.name: The Verge
technology.notes: Technology news and reviews. Part of Vox Media. Strong editorial team.

technology.name: Wired
technology.notes: Technology and culture magazine. Owned by Condé Nast. Long-form journalism.

finance_business.name: Bloomberg
finance_business.notes: Leading financial news service. Real-time market data. Global bureaus.

finance_business.name: The Economist
finance_business.notes: Global news and analysis magazine. Classical liberal perspective. Anonymous journalism.

sports.name: ESPN
sports.notes: Leading sports network. Comprehensive coverage. Owned by Disney.

sports.name: The Athletic
sports.notes: Subscription sports journalism. No ads. High-quality reporting. Owned by NYT.

visual_arts.name: Artforum
visual_arts.notes: Leading contemporary art magazine. International coverage. Prestigious.

visual_arts.name: Artnet News
visual_arts.notes: Daily art world news. Market analysis. Global coverage.

visual_arts.name: Hyperallergic
visual_arts.notes: Independent online arts magazine. Progressive perspective.

visual_arts.name: The Art Newspaper
visual_arts.notes: International art news. Museums, exhibitions, market.

music.name: Pitchfork
music.notes: Influential music criticism. Owned by Condé Nast.

music.name: Rolling Stone
music.notes: Iconic music magazine. Expanded to politics and culture.

music.name: NPR Music
music.notes: NPR's music coverage. Tiny Desk Concerts. High quality.

film.name: Variety
film.notes: Leading entertainment trade publication. Industry standard.

film.name: IndieWire
film.notes: Focus on independent and international cinema.

film.name: Criterion Collection
film.notes: High-quality film criticism. Classic and contemporary cinema.

theater.name: American Theatre
theater.notes: Theatre Communications Group publication. National coverage.

theater.name: The Stage
theater.notes: Leading UK theater publication. Industry standard.

literature.name: The Paris Review
literature.notes: Prestigious literary quarterly. The Art of Fiction interviews.

literature.name: The New York Review of Books
Literary Hub
literature.notes: Daily literary news and culture. Wide coverage.

architecture.name: ArchDaily
architecture.notes: World's most visited architecture website. Daily updates.

architecture.name: Dezeen
architecture.notes: Leading architecture and design magazine. Global coverage.

global_networks.name: International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ)
global_networks.notes: Panama Papers, Pandora Papers. Works with journalists worldwide. Selected Mediapart and independent outlets for major leaks.

global_networks.name: Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP)
global_networks.notes: Global network of investigative journalists. Major cross-border investigations.

global_networks.name: Global Investigative Journalism Network (GIJN)
global_networks.notes: Network of 200+ organizations. Training, resources, conferences.
